messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Sudbury
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/2/03 5:51:48 AM Eastern Daylight Time, ... Yes, I wasn t very clear about my motives for that.  I had read the Sudbury books and gotten
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/2/03 5:51:48 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
fetteroll@... writes:
> I think Sudbury Valley schools are great ideas. But great ideas for people
> whose goal is to open a Sudbury Valley school, not someone whose goal is to
> make money or free up her time or bring in playmates for her son.

Yes, I wasn't very clear about my motives for that. I had read the Sudbury
books and gotten very excited about the philosophy -- found out there weren't
any by me, and started thinking about opening one. It seemed to fall into
place with other possible needs -- dh is even thinking of skipping grad school and
joining me in running it because it's an idea that resonates with both of us.
We're going to visit some of the schools and keep considering it, but it's a
separate process than that of unschooling Fisher.

Peace,
Amy


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
